text: Hi there! Does the JuliaGraphs ecosystem include a weighted graph type with general weights? From the looks of it, `SimpleWeightedGraphs.jl` only accepts `Real` weights, and for my next project I need weights from abstract algebraic structures. Should I use `MetaGraphs.jl`, or write my own structure (without sparse matrices since they also prefer real entries)? Thanks :pray:

elements.text: Hi there! Does the JuliaGraphs ecosystem include a weighted graph type with general weights? From the looks of it,
weights, and for my next project I need weights from abstract algebraic structures. Should I use
, or write my own structure (without sparse matrices since they also prefer real entries)? Thanks

text: Depends on the size of your graph and the performance hat you need. MetaGraphs uses dicionaries to store metadata, so if you will have large graphs or algorithms that access metadata a lot  you might run in some issues.

text: I could also use some feedback/betatesters for <https://github.com/simonschoelly/SimpleValueGraphs.jl> if you wan to give that a try
